title: Lag in games
body: I've been getting really bad lag in games, often sitting around 300 ping, but my interent isnt lagging anywhere else, with any other game. This has only been happening the last 2 weeks. Reconnecting to the game doesnt help, and logging out of my computer and logging back in returns it to normal, but the after 15 minutes or so it shoots back up to 300. I'm with Optus, and dont use wifi, and i havent changed anything to do with my internet since I set it up 5 months ago. Please help.

replies.body:
Hey there,

Optus seems to have been having some issues lately with League and I'm honestly unsure why.

Could you do the following for me,

* [Download WinMTR](https://sourceforge.net/projects/winmtr/files/WinMTR-v092.zip/download) and run a traceroute to the following IP. (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)
  * 103.240.227.5
* Once adequate time has passed, stop the traceroute, export your results as text.
* Run the [ICSI netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/).
* Post back with a link to your WinMTR results (You can use [pastebin](http://pastebin.com/) for this) and a link to your ICSI netalyzr results.

These are the WINMTR results: http://pastebin.com/TYiVCtck
and here are the results of the netalyzr: http://n1.netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/summary/id=369839a0-22650-91937083-140b-49a0-ac81

There's definitely some noticeable packet loss on your route there, I'm unsure of its on your ISP's end though. You'll have to contact them regarding that.

Now, onto your netalyzr results.

* [Could you please switch to a public DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq5)
* You appear to have a high packet buffering rate, please check out [this support article on packet buffering](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq7) and the awesome video there by Player Support.
* Your systems clock appears to be out of sync, [please ensure that this is synced with an NTP](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/6410-clock-synchronize-internet-time-server-windows-10-a.html).

Let me know if any of the above helps, otherwise as said earlier in my post you'll have to contact your ISP.
